recipe.name: crepes
recipe.summary: The crepe is a dish made up of a very thin layer of dough made from flour (mainly wheat or buckwheat) agglomerated with a liquid (milk, sometimes mixed with water or beer). It is generally round in shape.

step.sentence: Mix the flour with the eggs, oil and salt.
Then add milk, beer and rum.
Mix it all: it's ready in two minutes with a mixer!
Cook in the pan with a knob of butter.
Enjoy your meal!
Wash and wipe the courgettes. Detail them in cubes with an onion cut
then cook 5 minutes in steam and let them cool.
Cut the feta into cubes.
In a bowl, mix the flour with the yeast.
Break the eggs in a bowl, whisk them with a fork and add the yoghurt.
Pour over flour
and whisk well.
Dissolve with olive oil, season with salt and pepper.
When the dough is smooth, add zucchini and feta.
Mix well with the spatula type maryse.
Pour into a cake pan.
Bake for 40 minutes at 180 degrees celsius. Check the cooking with the blade of a knife, it must come out dry. Let cool before unmolding.

ingredient.name: Champignons de Paris glazed to white

step.sentence: In a casserole, here in cast iron, melt the butter. Sear the chicken thighs on all sides, without too much coloring.
Meanwhile, chop the onion.
When chicken pieces are seized
add the onion. Stir well and cook for a few minutes.
Remove the chicken pieces
and continue baking in the oven for about 15 minutes. Reserve warm.
In sweet onions
add the clotted cream. Leave to reduce for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare the iced onions.
Start cooking with a lid made of parchment paper.
They are cooked when all the water is evaporated. Be careful to keep them white, do not brown.
Do the same with the mushrooms of Paris, washed and scalloped
until complete evaporation of the cooking water.
At the end of the cooking, gather them with the small onions in a saucepan.
Gather the chicken cream in the bowl of a blender. Mix thoroughly. If you do not have a blender, you can mix the sauce with a blender.
Pour this sauce over the iced onions and mushrooms.
Add the cooked chicken legs. Adjust seasoning. Keep warm until serving time.

recipe.name: moussaka
recipe.summary: The moussaka is a recipe that invites us to travel in time! Traditional dish of the Balkans, it is cooked in Asia Minor for centuries, but it is only in the 20th century that the modern moussaka is associated with Greece and Turkey. The origins of this vitamin dish made up of aubergines, onions and minced mutton: Nikolas Tselementes, a very influential Greek chef of the century, author of many cookbooks. For the small anecdote, the term moussaka comes from the Arabic musaqqa'a, meaning fresh. And yes, because in the Arab world, this is how it is consumed!

step.sentence: Rinse and dry the aubergines. Cut the stalk of each of them. Cut into slices with a knife or with a mandolin.
In a non-stick pan
brown them in olive oil, mixing regularly.
Drain on paper towels. Salt and pepper.
Peel and chop the onion. Here we use the "Alligator" onion cut which allows an easy and fast work.
Heat 2 oil tablespoon in the frying pan. Brown the chopped onion, 2 minutes over low heat.
Add the chopped meat.
Sauté 3 minutes over high heat.
Add the diced tomatoes and diced tomatoes, as well as garlic.
Season with salt, pepper and cinnamon.
Continue cooking for 15 minutes. Preheat your oven to 200 degrees celsius or thermostat 6 or 7.
In a saucepan, melt the butter.
Add the flour. Mix well
in order to obtain a white roux.
Deliver with boiling milk.
Bring to a boil without stopping mixing. Season with salt, pepper and a pinch of nutmeg.
Remove from heat, stir in egg yolks
and two-thirds of grated sheep cheese.
In an oiled gratin dish, arrange a layer of eggplant slices.
Cover with half the lamb filling.
Continue with a second layer of eggplant slices
the remainder of the ground meat
and finally the remaining eggplant.
Spoon sauce over surface. Sprinkle with remaining grated cheese.
Bake in oven for 25 minutes.
Serve very hot, directly in the baking dish.

recipe.name: basque chicken
recipe.summary: An emblematic dish of the Basque Country, Basque chicken was born in the depths of the French Basque Country: in Soule. Simmered as a casserole, it consisted initially of vegetables and bread. The chicken was added to the preparation afterwards. Dish of character, it is traditionally accompanied by tomatoes, onions and peppers of the Basque Country.

step.sentence: In a cast iron casserole, heat a bottom of oil and sear the chicken legs until the skin is golden brown. Flip the pieces frequently to color all faces. Salt.
Must the tomatoes.
Refresh and peel. Cut the tomatoes in half and crush them crudely.
When the thighs are well browned, remove them on a baking sheet
and finish baking between 180 and 200 degrees celsius for 10 to 15 minutes. Reserve warm.
In the cast-iron casserole still hot, sweat the chopped onions and peppers cut into strips.
Add the tomatoes. Season with salt, pepper, and a little Espelette pepper.
Add the chopped garlic and cook over medium heat for about 20 minutes.
When the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven
and add it in the sauce. Give one last boil and adjust the seasoning.
Serve very hot.

recipe.name: chocolate bar with chocolate beads biscuit

step.sentence: Mix the three varieties of Crispearls in equal quantities. In the absence of the three varieties, this recipe can be made with only Crispearls noirs, Crispearls blancs or Crispearls with milk.
Melt the chocolate cover in the microwave.
Pour it into a socket pocket.
Reserve a few minutes so that it cools slightly, but does not harden.
Spread the Crispearls on a baking sheet in a thick layer. Apply strips of melted chocolate directly to the Crispearls
7 to 8 centimeters long and about 1 centimeter wide.
Place in a cool place to make the chocolate harden.
Ten minutes later, remove the plate from the refrigerator and lift the chocolate bars to the biscuit chocolate beads.
Reserve in a cool place. These bars were made to replace the traditional chocolate square served with the coffee at the end of the meal. They can also be consumed as confectionery.
